description.narrative: The Project will work with both the national and the provincial governments. At the national level, the Project will help the Government strengthen sector planning and management by developing a sector strategy, a road map, and an investment program. A public-private partnership (PPP) framework will also be prepared together with the sector strategy to enable the Government to promote private sector involvement in the sector more effectively. At the provincial level, the Project will provide safe, reliable, and sustainable water supply and improved sanitation services in seven districts and one city in Surkhandarya Province. The services can be used as a model that can be replicated and expanded in other provinces. Besides investments in physical infrastructure for system rehabilitation and necessary upgrading, the Project will address the critical planning, management, financial, operational, and customer relations needs of the vodokanals (water supply and sanitation agencies) to improve service delivery efficiency.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: Safe, reliable, and sustainable water supply and sanitation services and improved community hygiene in participating urban centers of Surkhandarya

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President
Safe, reliable water is provided to 340,000 people by 2014, and to 367,000 by 2020

description.narrative: Safe, reliable, and sustainable water supply and sanitation services and improved community hygiene in participating urban centers of Surkhandarya

title.narrative: 80% of schoolchildren wash their hands with soap by 2014

description.narrative: Safe, reliable, and sustainable water supply and sanitation services and improved community hygiene in participating urban centers of Surkhandarya

title.narrative: Water supply is available at least 20 hrs a day by 2014, and 24 hrs a day by 2020

description.narrative: Safe, reliable, and sustainable water supply and sanitation services and improved community hygiene in participating urban centers of Surkhandarya

title.narrative: Unaccounted for Water (UFW) is reduced to less than 40% by 2014

description.narrative: Safe, reliable, and sustainable water supply and sanitation services and improved community hygiene in participating urban centers of Surkhandarya

title.narrative: Collection rate of water supply and sanitation charges increases to 90% by 2014
